source.name: Q3
source.instructions: In the context of a Kubernetes DaemonSet, what happens during a rolling update?

answers.answer: Old pod is killed, then new one created. This is done for all pods synonymously.
New pod is created, then old pod is killed. This is done for all pods synonymously.
Old pod is killed, then new one created. This is done one by one.
New pod is created, then old pod is killed. This is done one by one.
Rolling updates are not supported in DaemonSets, only `OnDelete` strategy.
